Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: LKM File to Netezza (NZLOAD) COMPONENT VERSION: 10.1.3.5 AUTHOR: Oracle COMPATIBILITY: ODI 10.1.3.5.0 and above
DESCRIPTION This LKM loads flat file data into Netezza by using the NZLoad utility. Call to NZLoad is made and a specific log file is created. Oracle recommends looking at this file in case of error. Log files (LOG) and Bad files (BAD) are placed in the work directory defined in the OUTPUT_DIR option.
REQUIREMENTS The source file must be accessible by the ODI agent executing the interface. The agent machine must have Netezza Performance Server client installed. All mappings need to be on the staging area. All source fields need to be mapped, and must be in the same order as the target table in Netezza. Date, Time, Timestamp and Numeric formats should be specified in consistent with Netezza Data Type definition.
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - DELETE_TEMP_OBJECTS: Delete temp objects after integration phase - DATA_FILE: Data file name. - LOG_FILE: Log file name. - BAD_FILE: Bad file name. - OUTPUT_DIR: Directory for log file and bad file. - MAX_ROWS: Number of rows to load. - MAX_ERRORS: Number of error rows before stop loading. - IGNORE_ZERO: Whether to ignore the byte value zero in char and varchar. - REQUIRE_QUOTES: Specify if quotes are mandatory. - NULL_VALUE: Specify the string to use for null value. - FILL_RECORD: Whether to fill records if input rows have fewer columns. - ESCAPE_CHAR: Specify the escape character. - CRIN_STRING: If it allows unescaped carriage returns. - CTRL_CHARS: If it allows ASCII (0-31) in string. - TRUNC_STRING: Truncate string if exceeds the storage. - BOOL_STYLE: Specify the boolean value style. - DATE_DELIM: Delimiter in Date. - DATE_STYLE: Style for Date. - Y2BASE: The beginning year if years is expressed as 2 digits. - TIME_DELIM: Delimiter for Time. - TIME_STYLE: Style for Time. - TIME_ROUND_NANOS: Round to nanos. - ALLOW_REPLAY: Enable load continuation.
LIMITATIONS LKM File to Netezza (NZLoad) will load flat files whose data types and formats are supported by NPS. It cannot load data whose formats are defined in Oracle Data Integrator manner. Source files must be delimited format.
Set this option to NO if you wish to retain temporary objects (files and scripts) after integration. Useful for debugging.
If not filepath is specified, current work directory will be used.
Specifies the log file name (append if file already exists). If not specified, the data file name appended with .log will be used.
If not specfied, it will be the data file appended by .bad. If the file already exists, overwrites it.
Specifies the output directory for the log/bad files. If not specified, the default value is current working directory.
Specifies stop loading after processing 'n' input rows. 0(all) means the NZLoad command attemps to locate the next input row until the input stream reaches the Enf-of-File.
how to treat byte value zero
Specifies whether to discard or treat the byte value zero in the char() and varchar() fields as an error. If set to no, generates error.
Specifies that quotes are mandatory, except for null values. Only valid when combined with option QUOTED_VALUE.
Specifies the string to use for the null value.
Specifies that an input line with fewer columns than the table definition is ok.
Specifies an escape character to use in char or varchar fields.
If this option is set to yes, it permits unescapted carriage returns (cr) in char/varchar fields, and line feed (LF) becomes the default end-of-row indicator.

Input is composed of the printing characters (bytes 33-255) ans space (byte 32), horizontal tab (byte 9), line feed (byte 10) and carriage return (byte 13). By default, you cannot use the nonprinting control characters.
If this option is set to yes, it permits control charascters (bytes 1-8, 11-12, and 14-31) to appear within strings. In this case, only 0, 10 and 13 are not allowed.
Specifies truncating any string value that exceeds its declared char or varchar storage.

Style Name Value 1_0 1 or 0 T_F T or F Y_N Y or N YES_NO YES or NO TRUE_FALSE TRUE or FALSE
If you specify the BOOL_STYLE as YES_NO, the NZLoad command assumes that the data in the Boolean field is in the from yes or no. If the data is any of the other values: true, false, 1, 0, t, f, y or n, the NZLoad command discards the record.
You can express the value in mixed case, so 'true' can be 'True' or 'TRUE' or 'tRuE'.
Specifies the delimiter to use with the dateStyle option.

Specifies how to interpret the date format.
Four-digit Year Two-digit Year Year Numeric-month Day YMD Y2MD Day Numeric-month Year DMY DMY2 Numeric-month Day Year MDY MDY2 Alphabetic-month Day Year MonDY MonDY2
Specifies the first year in YY format.
Specifies the delimiter to use for time formats.
Allows but rounds non-zero digits with smaller than microsecond resolution.

Enables load continuation <n> number of times if the system has been paused due to an SPU reset or failover. ONce the load continuations exceed the number specified, a rollback occurs. Note that multiple resets occurring before the system returns to normal operation counts as one ALLOW_REPLAY occurrence.

# # This step initializes the variables used in the next Jython steps # import java.lang.String import java.lang.System import os
# # Target connection variables # server = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_DSERV_NAME")%>" username = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_USER_NAME")%>" passwd = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_PASS")%>" target = "<%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "A")%>" database = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_WORK_CATALOG")%>"
# # Source connection variables # srcfileformat = "<%=snpRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_FORMAT]", "", "")%>" delim = "<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[SFILE_SEP_FIELD]", "", "")%>" skip_rows = "<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_FIRST_ROW]", "", "")%>" src_file = "<%=snpRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[RES_NAME]", "", "")%>"
quoted_value = "NO" <% if (odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_ENC_FIELD]", "", "").length()>0) {%> text_delim = "\<%=odiRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[FILE_ENC_FIELD]", "", "")%>" if text_delim == '"': quoted_value = "DOUBLE" elif text_delim == "\'": quoted_value = "SINGLE" <% } %>
temp_dir2 = r'<?=java.lang.System.getProperty("user.home")?>' os_name = "<?=java.lang.System.getProperty("os.name")?>" if os_name == "Windows": temp_dir = temp_dir2 else: temp_dir = temp_dir2 + "/"
# # NZLoad Options # data_file = r'<%=odiRef.getOption("DATA_FILE")%>' output_dir = r'<%=odiRef.getOption("OUTPUT_DIR")%>' log_file = r'<%=odiRef.getOption("LOG_FILE")%>' bad_file = r'<%=odiRef.getOption("BAD_FILE")%>'
if data_file == "": data_file = r'<%=snpRef.getSrcTablesList("", "[WORK_SCHEMA]/[RES_NAME]", "", "")%>'
if output_dir == "": output_dir = temp_dir if log_file == "": log_file = output_dir + src_file + '.log' if bad_file == "": bad_file = output_dir + src_file + '.bad'
max_rows = "<%=odiRef.getOption("MAX_ROWS")%>" max_errors = "<%=odiRef.getOption("MAX_ALLOWED_ERRORS")%>"
ignore_zero = "<%=odiRef.getOption("IGNORE_ZERO")%>" require_quotes = "<%=odiRef.getOption("REQUIRED_QUOTES")%>" null_value = "<%=odiRef.getOption("NULL_VALUE")%>" fill_record = "<%=odiRef.getOption("FILL_RECORD")%>"
escape_char = "<%=odiRef.getOption("ESCAPE_CHAR")%>" crin_string = "<%=odiRef.getOption("CRIN_STRING")%>" ctrl_chars = "<%=odiRef.getOption("CTRL_CHARS")%>" trunc_string = "<%=odiRef.getOption("TRUNC_STRING")%>"
bool_style = "<%=odiRef.getOption("BOOL_STYLE")%>"
date_delim = "<%=odiRef.getOption("DATE_DELIM")%>" date_style = "<%=odiRef.getOption("DATE_STYLE")%>" y2base = "<%=odiRef.getOption("Y2BASE")%>" time_delim = "<%=odiRef.getOption("TIME_DELIM")%>" time_style = "<%=odiRef.getOption("TIME_STYLE")%>" time_round_nanos = "<%=odiRef.getOption("TIME_ROUND_NANOS")%>"
allow_replay = "<%=odiRef.getOption("ALLOW_REPLAY")%>"
loadcmd = '''nzload -host %s -u %s -pw %s -db %s -t %s -df %s -lf %s -bf %s -delim '%s' -skipRows %s -maxRows %s -maxErrors %s -ignoreZero %s -quotedValue %s -nullValue %s -escapeChar '%s' -encoding internal -boolStyle %s -dateDelim '%s' -dateStyle %s -y2Base %s -timeDelim '%s' -timeStyle %s -allowReplay %s''' % (server,username,passwd,database,target,data_file,log_file,bad_file,delim,skip_rows,max_rows,max_errors,ignore_zero,quoted_value,null_value,escape_char,bool_style,date_delim,date_style,y2base,time_delim,time_style,allow_replay)
print loadcmd
#=========================== # load() #=========================== def load(): # Check if the file is delimited otherwise raise an error if srcfileformat == 'F': raise "Load Error", "This LKM works only with delimited files"
global loadcmd
if fill_record == '1': loadcmd += ' -fillRecord' if crin_string == '1': loadcmd += ' -crinString' if ctrl_chars == '1': loadcmd += ' -ctrlChars' if trunc_string == '1': loadcmd += ' -truncString' if time_round_nanos == '1': loadcmd += ' -timeRoundNanos' if require_quotes == '1' and (quoted_value == 'YES' or quoted_value == 'SINGLE' or quoted_value == 'DOUBLE'): loadcmd += ' -requireQuotes'
print loadcmd
if os.system(loadcmd) == 1 : raise "Load Error", "See %s for details" % log_file
Report the number of loaded rows
